availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Born in Lexington, Kentucky on September 13, 1831. Graduated from Transylvania University in 1849. Admitted to the Kentucky Bar in 1852. That same year, Cleary moved to Cynthiana, Harrison County, Kentucky to establish his practice. He served in the State legislature from 1859 - 1861. He was a pro-Secessionist. After Kentucky sided with the Union, Cleary joined the Confederate Army. He was soon called to Richmond where he was given a diplomatic assignment in Bermuda and Canada. He served in this capacity for the remainder of the war. Died in Covington, Kentucky on March 16, 1897.

bibl.p: E. Polk Johnson, A History of Kentucky and Kentuckians: The Leaders and Representative Men in Commerce, Industry and Modern Activities, Vol. II (New York: The Lewis Publishing Company, 1912), 681; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States_(1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison, Cynthiana, p. 575; Find A Grave, "William Walter Cleary (September 13, 1831- March 16, 1897)," Memorial #1556053434, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=156053434&ref=acom (accessedJune 26, 2017).
